COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
D.C. Resolution 19-754, effective December 18, 2012

20 DCSTAT 563

A RESOLUTION

Proposed Resolution
19-1178

To declare the existence of an emergency with respect to the taxation of real property in the District of
Columbia of the Beulah Baptist Church and its related entities.

See Emergency Act
D.C. Act 19-621
20 DCSTAT 386

RESOLVED, BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this
resolution may be cited as the “Beulah Baptist Church Real Property Equitable Tax Relief
Emergency Declaration Resolution of 2012”.

Beulah Baptist
Church Real
Property Equitable
Tax Relief
Emergency
Declaration
Resolution of 2012

Sec. 2. (a) It is necessary to exempt from Class 3 taxation real property in the District
of Columbia of the Beulah Baptist Church and its related entities, all tax-exempt organizations.
(b) This legislation is needed to facilitate development of mixed-use projects, such as
affordable housing, retail, and a business incubator, as soon as possible on this property.
(c) Funding existed in Fiscal Year 2012, but this authorization is necessary for it to be
funded in Fiscal Year 2013.
Sec. 3. The Council of the District of Columbia determines that the circumstances
enumerated in section 2 constitute emergency circumstances making it necessary that the
Beulah Baptist Church Real Property Equitable Tax Relief Emergency Act of 2012 be adopted
after a single reading.
Sec. 4. This resolution shall take effect immediately.
